intro: Choristigma stuckertianum, commonly known as the Stuckert's choristigma, is a rare and unique plant species belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense, compact clusters. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. Native to specific regions in South America, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
